definitions.definition: involving doing something together or working together with others towards a shared aim

examples.text: Cooperative activity is essential to effective community work.
The documentary was a cooperative effort by film-makers from five countries.
This is a cooperative venture with the University of Copenhagen.

definitions.definition: helpful by doing what you are asked to do

examples.text: Employees will generally be more cooperative if their views are taken seriously.

definitions.definition: owned and run by the people involved, with the profits shared by them

examples.text: The cooperative movement started in Britain in the nineteenth century.

wordOrigin: early 17th cent.: from late Latin cooperativus, from Latin cooperat- ‘worked together’, from the verb cooperari, from co- ‘together’ + operari ‘to work’.
